column4: i have a desktop machine running ubuntu with a printer attached to it and a laptop with wireless running xp...i have tried to setup my desktop so i can share the printer, but keep getting an error in xp...can anyone help?
if that doesnt work you can run samba
can you also do a printscreen of your desktop with the error showing and paste it to the pastebin?
is the printer set up on the ubuntu machine?
are you using cups?
can you access cups from the laptop?
^^see last post
i just downloaded a screenshot of my xp error that i am getting.  when u get a chance can u check it out please?
what is the address of it?
by default xp sends out passod encrypted and CUPS doesnt like it
by default xp sends out passwords encrypted and CUPS doesnt like it
i think so... can u give me specific instructions on browsing for the printer in cups??
it already lists my printer in there.  should i add the printer again using localhosts:631?
when i press one of the buttons on localhost:631 it asks for a username and password.  how do i setup a username and password?
did i miss something?  sorry. been doing 2 things at once
you hae to set up the users in ubuntu as well as a group
hang on
use this guide http://www.linuxtopia.org/online_books/system_administration_books/ubuntu_starter_guide/ch06.html
thanx.  i am there now
still a bit confused.  i already have a username set.  do i just need to create a group for my printer and allow my username to be used for it?
can i name the group anything i want?  such as printer?
nickrud you can add yourself to the lpadmin, I've been trying to reember the name of the group but thats it
